file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 05-20-07-06 - FORWARD FUSELAGE I - ELECTRONIC COMPARTMENT - INTERNAL - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FORWARD FUSELAGE I - ELECTRONIC COMPARTMENT - INTERNAL - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the visual inspection of NLG & FWD Electronic Compartments / FWD Pressure Bulkhead upper side for general condition. B. Related Zones: 113/114/213/214/215/216. C. Zone Boundaries: STA X = 600.0 thru STA X = 2364.0. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY NLG & FWD ELECTRONIC COMPART- MENTS / FWD PRESSURE BULKHEAD ALL 05-20-07-200-801-A ♦ UPPER SIDE - INTERNAL GENERAL VIS- UAL INSPECTION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 05-20-07 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 05-20-07-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. NLG & FWD ELECTRONIC COMPARTMENTS / FWD PRESSURE BULKHEAD UPPER SIDE - INTERNAL GENERAL VISUAL INSPECTION A. General (1) This procedure obeys the EWIS ICA requirement. (2) This task gives instructions to do SRMD Zonal Task 53-Z213-214-001-A00. (3) You must do the internal general visual inspection (GVI) of forward fuselage I, at zones 113/114/213/214/215/216, within a touching distance of the items examined. (4) The function of the internal general visual inspection (GVI) is to find damage, failure, or irregular conditions that can be easily seen. (5) Apart from any specific targets defined in the Zonal Inspection task, a General Visual Inspection (GVI) must be conducted of the entire zone specified and includes all installations, components and structures. Refer to AMM Introduction for zonal inspection criteria. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 12-23-00-600-801-A/300 - AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-802-A/400 - WM 20-22-00 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113AZ Forward electronic compartment 113 113BZ Forward electronic compartment 113 113CZ Forward electronic compartment 114 114AZ Forward electronic compartment 114 114BZ Forward electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Standard Stand To get access to the inspection area EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-20-07 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Forward fuselage I - electronic compart- 1 Does the task ment I. Preparation (Figure 601) SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Put the stand in position. (2) Open access panel 113AZ, 113BZ, 113CZ, 114AZ, and 114BZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) (Figure 601). (3) Remove thermoacoustic insulation pads, at zones 213/214/215/216 (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-802-A/400) as applicable. J. Internal General Visual Inspection (Figure 602) SUBTASK 212-002-A (1) Examine the interior of the zone for loose rivets, skin deformation, nicks, cracks, dents, sealant poor condition, scratches, couges, creases, erosion, corrosion, rack structures, painting, and deteriorated protective treatment and foreign objects. (2) Examine the splices, circumferential splices, stringers, frames/bulkheads and pressure bulkhead for loose rivets, scratches, couges, creases, cracks, skin deformation, painting, corrosion, and deteriorated protective treatment (Figure 602). (3) Examine drains for signs of corrosion. Also do a check for blockage and correct operation (AMM TASK 12-23-00-600-801-A/300). (4) Examine the EWIS components for signs of damage, adequate installation, chafing and general condition. Refer to WM 20-22-00. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 841-002-B (1) Install thermoacoustic insulation pads, at zones 213/214/215/216 (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-802-A/400) as applicable. (2) Close access panel 113AZ, 113BZ, 113CZ, 114AZ, and 114BZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) Remove the stand in position.
